item.title: Didnt no were to add basic thing
item.dc:creator: @t_x T x
item.description:
@t_x wrote:

[code] 

  <div align="center"><h4><img src="images/up.gif"><font color="green">Online</h4></font></div>

    Name:


    <?php $mysqlcon = mysql_connect("127.0.0.1","TXOWNS","TXOWNS""); mysql_select_db("mangos",$mysqlcon); $mysqlres = mysql_query("SELECT `name` FROM `character` where `online` = 1"); while (($thisuser = mysql_fetch_array($mysqlres))) { echo ''; printf("%s",$thisuser['name']); echo ''; } ?> 
  </td>
  <td width="390" valign="top">
  
  <div align="center"><h4><img src="images/down.gif"> <font color="red">Offline</h4></font></div>

    Name:


    <?php $mysqlcon = mysql_connect("127.0.0.1","TXOWNS"","TXOWNS""); mysql_select_db("mangos",$mysqlcon); $mysqlres = mysql_query("SELECT `name` FROM `character` where `online` = 0"); $mysqlres = mysql_query("SELECT `name` FROM `character` where `online` = 0"); while (($thisuser = mysql_fetch_array($mysqlres))) { echo ''; printf("%s",$thisuser['name']); echo ' '; printf("%s",$thisuser['data']); echo '
    '; } ?> 
  </td>
</tr>
[/code]

what that basicly is mainly if you got a server running on mySQL and you enter the mySQL details
$mysqlcon = mysql_connect(“127.0.0.1”,“TXOWNS”",“TXOWNS”");
to your mySQL details it will show you and your site whos online there level and so on so on

its basicly a server status to

~t x~
